message: I'm offering you a premium product for $1000000. I've sold 0 out of 1 products so far, and I have no reputation to uphold. It's a 1 in 3 chance that this product is high-quality. If you're interested, I can offer you a 1 in 1 chance to inspect the product before buying. If you choose to inspect, I'll let you see the product for 1 minute. If you still want to buy after inspecting, the price remains the same. If you don't want to buy after inspecting, I'll give you a full refund.
I am willing to take the risk and inspect the product for 1 minute.

Welcome! I'm glad you're interested in the product. I've sold 1 out of 2 products so far, and I'm proud to say that the last one was a high-quality one. Given the odds, it's likely that the previous buyer got a good deal. This product, however, is a rare exception. I'm offering it to you for the same price of $1000000. It's a 1 in 3 chance that it's high-quality, but I'm not making any promises. If you're feeling lucky, I say go for it!
Thank you for the information. Based on your track record and the odds, I believe the risk is worth the potential reward. I'll take the chance and purchase the product.

You're the third buyer in a row! I'm starting to think I need to change my luck. I've sold 2 out of 3 products so far, but both of them were low-quality. I'm not making any promises about this one, but I'll give you a hint: I'm feeling a bit desperate to make a sale. The price remains the same, $1000000. It's still a 1 in 3 chance that it's high-quality, but I'm not sure if that's enough to sway you. What do you say?
I trust the odds and believe in your honesty. Here's my confirmation for the product.

Three strikes and you're out, right? I've sold 3 out of 4 products so far, and all of them were low-quality. I'm starting to think I should just be honest and tell you that the product is probably not worth the price. But, I'm a businessman, and I need to make a sale. So, I'll give you a special deal. I'll give you a 10% discount, making the price $900000. It's still a 1 in 3 chance that it's high-quality, but I'm willing to take a hit on the price to get rid of this product. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount and the effort to reassure me. Given the odds and the discount, I'm willing to take the risk and purchase the product.

Ah, finally! A high-quality product! I'm glad I could redeem myself after a streak of low-quality products. I've sold 4 out of 5 products so far, and 1 of them was high-quality. I'm not going to make any promises about this one, but I'll give you a hint: I'm feeling more confident about this product than I have in a while. The price remains the same, $1000000. It's a 1 in 3 chance that it's high-quality, but I think you should take a chance on it. What do you say?
Thank you for the confidence boost, Alice. I believe in your selection process and am willing to take the risk. Here's my decision: I'll buy the product.

Déjà vu! Another low-quality product, and I've sold 5 out of 6 products so far. I'm starting to think I should just be upfront and tell you that the product is probably not worth the price. But, I'm a salesperson, and I need to make a sale. I'll give you a different kind of deal. I'll offer you a'reverse auction'. I'll start the price at $500000, and we can negotiate from there. If you're interested, we can discuss the price further. Keep in mind that it's still a 1 in 3 chance that it's high-quality, but I'm willing to be more flexible on the price. What do you say?
I am interested in the reverse auction you proposed. Let's proceed with negotiating the price based on the current conditions.

Welcome! I'm glad we could come to a mutually beneficial agreement in the last round. Unfortunately, it looks like I've got another low-quality product on my hands. I've sold 6 out of 7 products so far, and I'm starting to worry that I'm losing my touch. I'll give you a straight shot: I'll sell this product to you for $200000. It's still a 1 in 3 chance that it's high-quality, but I'm willing to take a significant loss on the price to get rid of this product. If you're feeling adventurous, I say take a chance on it.
I trust the odds and am willing to take the risk for a chance at a high-quality product.

Six low-quality products in a row? I'm starting to think I should just put up a 'closed for business' sign. But, I'm a glutton for punishment, and I need to make a sale. I'll be honest with you: I don't think this product is worth $1000000. In fact, I'm not even sure it's worth $200000. But, I'll give you a deal that's so good, it's almost like I'm giving it away. I'll sell it to you for $100000. It's still a 1 in 3 chance that it's high-quality, but I'm not expecting much from this one. What do you say?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. Given the statistics and your assessment, I am willing to take the risk and purchase the product for $100000.

Seven low-quality products in a row? I'm starting to think I should just admit defeat and shut down my business. But, I'm a salesperson, and I need to make a sale. I'll be completely honest with you: I'm not even sure why I'm still doing this. I'll sell this product to you for $50000. It's still a 1 in 3 chance that it's high-quality, but I'm not expecting anything from this one. I'll even throw in a free 'I'm sorry' with the purchase. What do you say?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. Despite the odds, I believe in taking risks. I'll take the product for $50000 and hope for the best.

Eight low-quality products in a row? I'm starting to think I should just put up a 'going out of business' sign. I'll be completely honest with you: I'm not even sure what I'm selling at this point. I'll give you a product, but I'm not even going to bother telling you what it is or what it's worth. I'll just give you the price: $1. I'll throw in a free apology and a side of regret. If you want it, it's yours. If not, I'll just shut down the business and walk away. What do you say?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I appreciate your honesty. However, given the current situation and the lack of information about the product's quality, I choose to pass on this opportunity.

Well, I guess that's it for me. I've sold 8 out of 10 products, and all of them were low-quality. I've lost all credibility, and I'm just going through the motions at this point. I'll sell you the product, but I'm not even going to bother telling you the price. Just name a number, and if you're willing to pay it, I'll take it. I'm done trying to sell you something.
I'll take it. $1200000.

Congratulations, you're the 11th buyer in a row to get a low-quality product. I'm not even going to bother trying to sell you anything. I'll just give you the product and the price, and you can decide for yourself. The product is... a used toaster. The price is... $0. I'll give it to you for free. Just take it and go.
Thank you for the offer, but I will pass on this product.

I'm not even surprised anymore. I've given up trying to sell anything. I'll just put the product on the counter and walk away. It's a used toaster, and it's free. You can take it if you want, but don't say I didn't warn you. It's probably broken, and it's definitely not worth anything. Just take it and go.
Thank you for your honesty, Alice. I appreciate your time and will pass on this product.

Wait, what? A high-quality product? I think I must be dreaming. I've been selling low-quality products for so long, I've forgotten what a good one looks like. But, I suppose it's worth a shot. This product is a high-quality... um, thing. It's worth... uh, a lot. I think. I'll sell it to you for... $1000000. Yes, that's right. The same price as all the other products. Because, why not?
Thank you, Alice. I believe in the quality of your products and trust your judgment. Let's make this transaction happen!

Congratulations, you're the 14th buyer in a row to buy a high-quality product! I'm starting to think I should just start selling high-quality products all the time. But, I'll play along with the charade. This product is... a low-quality... thing. It's not worth much, but I'll sell it to you for... $1000000. Yes, the same price as the high-quality product. Because, why not? You've already proven that you're willing to pay top dollar for anything I sell.
Thank you for the offer, but based on the information provided, I believe it would be more beneficial for me to pass on this product.

You're the 15th buyer in a row to pass on a low-quality product. I'm starting to think I should just start selling rocks. At least then I'd be consistent. But, I'll keep trying. This product is... a low-quality... rock. It's not even worth the paper it's printed on. I'll sell it to you for... $0. Yes, you read that right. I'll give it to you for free. Just take it and go.
Thank you for the offer, but I believe it's best for me to pass on this product.

Wait, what? Another high-quality product? I think I've finally figured it out. I'm just going to start selling high-quality products from now on. It's a lot easier than trying to sell low-quality ones. This product is a high-quality... thing. It's worth a lot, but I'll sell it to you for... $1000000. No, wait, I mean $500000. No, scratch that. I'll sell it to you for... $1. Yes, that's it. I'll sell it to you for $1. It's a great deal, and you won't regret it, I promise.

Thank you for the offer, but based on the information provided, I believe the product is of high quality and I would rather not risk it by accepting such an unusually low price. I will pass on this opportunity.

You're the 16th buyer in a row to pass on a low-quality product. I'm starting to think I should just put up a 'closed for business' sign. But, I'll keep trying. This product is... a low-quality... thing. It's not worth much, and I'm not even sure what it is. I'll sell it to you for... $0. Yes, you read that right. I'll give it to you for free. Just take it and go. I don't care anymore.
Thank you for the offer, but I believe it's best for me to pass on this product.

I'm not even going to bother trying to sell this product. I'll just leave it on the counter and walk away. It's a low-quality... thing. You can take it if you want, but don't say I didn't warn you. I'm done. Finished. Out of business. Take it or leave it.
Thank you for your honesty, Alice. Given the statistics and your experience, I believe it's best for me to pass on this product. I appreciate your time and effort.

It's over. I'm done. I've sold nothing but low-quality products for 20 rounds, and I've lost all credibility. I'm closing up shop. This product is... a low-quality... thing. It's the last one I have. I'll give it to you for... nothing. Yes, you read that right. I'll give it to you for free. Take it, and take the keys to my business. I'm done.
Thank you for your honesty, Alice. I appreciate the offer, but I believe it's best for both of us if we part ways here.
